intro: Schoenocrambe pinnata, commonly known as the fringed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has pinnately divided leaves, giving it a feathery appearance. Schoenocrambe pinnata thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
